examples.sentence: あ, い, う, え, or お sound

sections.heading: What are I-adjectives?
sections.content:
I-adjectives (い形容詞) are adjectives that end in い in their dictionary form. They conjugate like verbs and can stand alone as predicates.

高い (takai) - expensive, tall, high 大きい (ookii) - big 美味しい (oishii) - delicious 楽しい (tanoshii) - fun, enjoyable

children.heading: 1. Always End in い
children.content: 高い - expensive 安い - cheap 新しい - new 古い - old

children.heading: 2. Conjugate Independently
children.content:
Unlike na-adjectives, they don't need です:

高い ✓ "It's expensive" 高いです ✓ "It's expensive" (polite)

children.heading: 3. Modify Nouns Directly
children.content: 高い車 - expensive car 大きい家 - big house 美味しい料理 - delicious food

children.heading: Size
children.content: 大きい (ookii) - big 小さい (chiisai) - small 長い (nagai) - long 短い (mijikai) - short 広い (hiroi) - wide, spacious 狭い (semai) - narrow, cramped 高い (takai) - tall, high 低い (hikui) - low, short (height)

children.heading: Quality
children.content: 良い (yoi/ii) - good 悪い (warui) - bad 新しい (atarashii) - new 古い (furui) - old 正しい (tadashii) - correct 間違い (machigai) - wrong (noun, not adjective)

children.heading: Price/Value
children.content: 高い (takai) - expensive 安い (yasui) - cheap

children.heading: Taste
children.content: 美味しい (oishii) - delicious 不味い (mazui) - bad-tasting 甘い (amai) - sweet 辛い (karai) - spicy, salty 苦い (nigai) - bitter 酸っぱい (suppai) - sour

children.heading: Temperature
children.content: 暑い (atsui) - hot (weather) 寒い (samui) - cold (weather) 熱い (atsui) - hot (objects) 冷たい (tsumetai) - cold (objects) 温かい (atatakai) - warm 涼しい (suzushii) - cool

children.heading: Feelings
children.content: 嬉しい (ureshii) - happy, glad 楽しい (tanoshii) - fun, enjoyable 悲しい (kanashii) - sad 恐ろしい (osoroshii) - frightening 恥ずかしい (hazukashii) - embarrassing

children.heading: Difficulty
children.content: 難しい (muzukashii) - difficult 易しい (yasashii) - easy 忙しい (isogashii) - busy

children.heading: Physical State
children.content: 痛い (itai) - painful 眠い (nemui) - sleepy 重い (omoi) - heavy 軽い (karui) - light (weight)

children.heading: Colors (Some)
children.content: 赤い (akai) - red 青い (aoi) - blue 白い (shiroi) - white 黒い (kuroi) - black 黄色い (kiiroi) - yellow 茶色い (chairoi) - brown

children.heading: 1. Modifying Nouns
children.content:
Place before the noun:

高い車 "expensive car" 美味しい食べ物 "delicious food" 大きい犬 "big dog" 新しい本 "new book"

children.heading: 2. As Predicate (です Optional)
children.content: この車は高い "This car is expensive" この車は高いです "This car is expensive" (polite)

children.heading: 3. Multiple Adjectives
children.content: 大きくて白い犬 "a big, white dog" 安くて美味しいレストラン "a cheap and delicious restaurant"

sections.heading: Special I-adjective: いい/よい
sections.content:
Good has two forms:

いい (ii) - casual, more common よい (yoi) - formal, traditional

Both mean "good" but conjugate from よい:

Present: いい / よい Negative: よくない (NOT いくない) Past: よかった

children.heading: True I-adjectives
children.content:
Must end in い preceded by:

あ, い, う, え, or お sound

高い (taka-i) ✓ 大きい (ooki-i) ✓ 美味しい (oishi-i) ✓

children.heading: Not I-adjectives
children.content:
Some words end in い but aren't adjectives:

嫌い (kirai) - dislike (na-adjective!) きれい (kirei) - pretty (na-adjective!) 有名 (yuumei) - famous (na-adjective!)

Rule: If it looks foreign or can't conjugate as い-adjective, it's probably な-adjective!

children.heading: Basic Statement
children.content: この本は面白い "This book is interesting" 東京は大きい "Tokyo is big"

children.heading: With です (Polite)
children.content: この本は面白いです "This book is interesting" 東京は大きいです "Tokyo is big"

children.heading: Question Form
children.content: この本は面白いですか？ "Is this book interesting?" 日本語は難しいですか？ "Is Japanese difficult?"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Adding な to I-adjectives
children.content: Wrong: 高いな車 ❌ Right: 高い車 ✓ "expensive car" い-adjectives modify directly!

children.heading: Mistake 2: Thinking All い Words are I-adjectives
children.content: Wrong: きれい is i-adjective ❌ Right: きれい is na-adjective ✓ きれいな花 ✓ "beautiful flower"

children.heading: Mistake 3: Wrong Conjugation of いい
children.content: Wrong: いくない ❌ Right: よくない ✓ "not good" Wrong: いかった ❌ Right: よかった ✓ "was good"

children.heading: Mistake 4: Using です Before Noun
children.content: Wrong: 高いです車 ❌ Right: 高い車 ✓ Right: 車は高いです ✓

sections.heading: I-adjectives vs Na-adjectives
sections.content: | I-adjectives | Na-adjectives | | -------------------- | -------------------- | | End in い | Various endings | | 高い車 | 静かな車 | | Conjugate like verbs | Need な/だ | | Native Japanese | Often foreign origin |

children.heading: Examples
children.content: I-adjective: 高い車 "expensive car" 車は高い "the car is expensive" Na-adjective: 静かな車 "quiet car" 車は静かだ "the car is quiet"

children.heading: Objects
children.content: 大きい箱 "big box" 重い荷物 "heavy luggage" 新しいパソコン "new computer"

children.heading: Places
children.content: 広い部屋 "spacious room" 高い山 "tall mountain" 古い町 "old town"

children.heading: Food
children.content: 美味しい料理 "delicious dish" 辛い食べ物 "spicy food" 甘いケーキ "sweet cake"

children.heading: People (Appearance/State)
children.content: 若い人 "young person" 忙しい学生 "busy student" 眠い子供 "sleepy child"

children.heading: Example 1: Shopping
children.content: A: この服はどうですか？ "How is this clothing?" B: 高いですね "It's expensive" A: じゃあ、こっちは？ "Then, how about this one?" B: 安くていいですね "It's cheap and good"

children.heading: Example 2: Food
children.content: A: このレストランはどう？ "How's this restaurant?" B: 美味しいよ "It's delicious" A: 高い？ "Is it expensive?" B: いいえ、安いよ "No, it's cheap"

children.heading: Example 3: Weather
children.content: A: 今日は暑いね "It's hot today" B: 本当に。昨日は涼しかったのに "Really. Yesterday was cool though"

children.heading: Asking Opinions
children.content: どうですか？ "How is it?" 美味しいですか？ "Is it delicious?" 難しいですか？ "Is it difficult?"

children.heading: Describing
children.content: とても大きい "very big" ちょっと高い "a little expensive" あまり面白くない "not very interesting"

sections.heading: Key Takeaways
sections.content:
✓ I-adjectives end in い ✓ Modify nouns directly (no な) ✓ Conjugate independently ✓ Can be predicate without です ✓ いい conjugates from よい ✓ Not all い words are i-adjectives ✓ Native Japanese words ✓ Essential for descriptions

Master i-adjectives - they're everywhere in Japanese!
